New Records: Shakib Al Hasan has taken 10 wickets in 4 games against India since 2022, averaging 18 and a strike rate of 24.
Key Match Events: The match is a pivotal World Cup clash between India and Bangladesh, with Bangladesh looking to capitalize on recent successes against India.
Shakib Al Hasan's availability is a key factor, with his potential absence impacting Bangladesh's strategy.
The Pune Stadium's small boundaries and recent spin-friendly conditions are noted.
The weather could play a role, with a cyclone warning affecting game conditions.
Pre-Game Insights: Virat Kohli highlighted Shakib Al Hasan's skills and experience.
Paras Mhambrey emphasized Jasprit Bumrah's importance to the Indian team.
Mohammed Siraj has a strong PowerPlay record and will aim to exploit Bangladesh's top order.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rohit Sharma averages 69.66 against Bangladesh as captain in ODIs.
Shakib Al Hasan has three 50+ scores in four World Cup games against India.
Only 6 wickets have fallen to spinners in the last three matches at Pune.
Others: The Indian team is unlikely to make changes to their XI from the Pakistan match.
Bangladesh's XI is uncertain with Shakib's status, potentially leading to lineup changes.
